edu.swarthmore.cs.spoon.interfaces

Interface Action


  • public interface Action
    An Action refers to player action that costs spoons, affecting the Spoon Allowance Point System within the game.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> beginAction()
      Begins the Action.
      boolean canGetHelpForAction()
      A function that indicates whether or not the Action that the player is trying to do is something that they can receive help on from another player
      boolean canPerformAction()
      Indicates whether or not one can perform the action they're trying to do.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> endAction()
      Ends the Action, and provides all associated dialogue with ending the Action.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getActionDescription()
      An Action will have a provided description of the Action, which may provide hints on the consequences of the Action for the player.
      java.lang.String getActionName()
      Each Action has a name to identify the Action.
      int getActionSpoonCost()
      An action has an associated spoon cost.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getActionStatusEffects()
      Some Actions may, as a consequence, directly affect player stats.
      void setActionName(java.lang.String string)
      Sets an Action's Name.
      void setSpoonCost(int num)
      Sets the spoon cost of the action.

    • Method Detail

      • getActionName

        java.lang.String getActionName()
        Each Action has a name to identify the Action.
        Returns:
        a string indicating the name of the action.

      • getActionDescription

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getActionDescription()
        An Action will have a provided description of the Action, which may provide hints on the consequences of the Action for the player.
        Returns:
        a list of strings indicating any associated description with the action, suitable for dialogue, OR null if there is no provided description

      • getActionSpoonCost

        int getActionSpoonCost()
        An action has an associated spoon cost.
        Returns:
        an integer indicating the spoon cost for the action

      • getActionStatusEffects

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getActionStatusEffects()
        Some Actions may, as a consequence, directly affect player stats.
        Returns:
        a list of strings, each string indicating a player stat that taking the action successfully can affect the status listed by each string. OR null if there is no status effect

      • setActionName

        void setActionName(java.lang.String string)
        Sets an Action's Name.
        Parameters:
        string - a string representing the action name.

      • canPerformAction

        boolean canPerformAction()
        Indicates whether or not one can perform the action they're trying to do.
        Returns:
        true if the player can perform the action, and return false if they can't.

      • setSpoonCost

        void setSpoonCost(int num)
        Sets the spoon cost of the action.
        Parameters:
        num - an integer representing the spoon cost. Returns

      • canGetHelpForAction

        boolean canGetHelpForAction()
        A function that indicates whether or not the Action that the player is trying to do is something that they can receive help on from another player
        Returns:
        true, if the player can call for help for the Action, OR false if the player cannot call for help for the Action.

      • beginAction

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> beginAction()
        Begins the Action. All Actions are guided by dialogue.
        Returns:
        a list of strings, each string indicating dialogue within the game, OR null if there is no dialogue

      • endAction

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> endAction()
        Ends the Action, and provides all associated dialogue with ending the Action.
        Returns:
        a list of strings indicating action's ending dialogue and consequences, OR null if there is no dialogue
